Package com.cafean.client.ui.pview

Class GroupPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • com.cafean.client.ui.pview.GroupPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySetListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible
    public class GroupPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, PropertySetListener
    A panel representing an attribute group (or "General") containing a set of PropertyPanel instances, each representing a property.
    See Also:
    PropertySetPanel, PropertyPanel, PropertySet, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • highlightProperty

        public void highlightProperty​(java.lang.String propertyName)
        Expands this group panel (if it isn't already) and temporarily highlights the name label of the property with the given name. If the property is not available in this group then the call will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        propertyName - a String containing the name (not display name) of the property to highlight.

      • getHighlightedProperty

        public java.lang.String getHighlightedProperty()
        Returns the name of the property currently selected in this panel.
        Returns:
        a String containing the name of the highlighted property or null if no property is currently highlighted

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Retrieves the name of the attribute group that this panel is displaying.
        Overrides:
        getName in class java.awt.Component

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.awt.Component

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
        Returns true if this panel is actively displaying/editing PropertySet values.
        See Also:
        activate(java.lang.String)

      • getPropertySet

        public PropertySet getPropertySet()
        retrieves the PropertySet that this group panel is displaying

      • isExpanded

        public boolean isExpanded()
        Returns true if this panel has been expanded

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns true if this panel has been expanded

      • getExpansion

        public PanelExpansion getExpansion()
        Retrieves this panel's expansion state.
        Returns:
        a PanelExpansion describing this panel by name and it's expanded state.

      • deactivate

        public void deactivate()
        Deactivates and collapses this panel.

        Note: This method is safe to call repeatedly on a deactivated panel.

        See Also:
        collapse()

      • collapse

        public void collapse()
        Reverts this panel to it's unexpanded state.

      • activate

        public void activate​(java.lang.String attributeGroup)
        Activates this panel displaying the given attribute group name.

        Note: This method does not expand the panel but must be called before it is expanded.

        Parameters:
        attributeGroup - a String containing the attribute group name to display

      • expand

        public void expand()
        Expands this panel to allow it's contained properties to be visible.

      • expand

        public void expand​(PanelExpansion exp)
        Expands this panel based on the given expansion if its name matches the given expansion's name.
        Parameters:
        exp - the PanelExpansion to expand based on.

      • expand

        public void expand​(boolean scrollToVisible)
        Expands this panel and displays it's properties (if not empty ).
        Parameters:
        scrollToVisible - if true this panel will scrollRectToVisible upon expansion.

      • scrollToVisible

        public void scrollToVisible()
        Attempts to scroll this group panel to visible via the EDT.
        See Also:
        JComponent.scrollRectToVisible(java.awt.Rectangle), SwingUtilities.invokeLater(java.lang.Runnable)
